elements.description:
Element that renders a calendar cell for a given date (and for non-date cells in the calendar).

### Usage

    <px-calendar-cell
      display-date="{{...}}"
      first-range-date="{{...}}"
      second-range-date="{{...}}">
    </px-calendar-cell>

properties.name: blockFutureDates
properties.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow future dates to be selected (future dates will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: blockPastDates
properties.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow past dates to be selected (past dates will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: fromMoment
properties.description: Moment object start date & time

properties.name: toMoment
properties.description: Moment object end date & time

properties.name: displayDate
properties.description: Moment object with date to display in this cell

properties.name: displayMode
properties.description:
What the calendar should display:
 'day': day number
 'month': month
 'year': year

properties.name: blockDatesAfter
properties.description: blocks the selection/navigation for any dates after this one.

properties.name: blockDatesBefore
properties.description: blocks the selection/navigation for any dates before this one.

methods.name: _updateDate
methods.description: Go through each cell and decide if it has a day in that month, is it selected, inbetween selected, etc.

attributes.name: block-future-dates
attributes.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow future dates to be selected (future dates will be disabled and unclickable).

attributes.name: block-past-dates
attributes.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow past dates to be selected (past dates will be disabled and unclickable).

attributes.name: from-moment
attributes.description: Moment object start date & time

attributes.name: to-moment
attributes.description: Moment object end date & time

attributes.name: display-date
attributes.description: Moment object with date to display in this cell

attributes.name: display-mode
attributes.description:
What the calendar should display:
 'day': day number
 'month': month
 'year': year

attributes.name: block-dates-after
attributes.description: blocks the selection/navigation for any dates after this one.

attributes.name: block-dates-before
attributes.description: blocks the selection/navigation for any dates before this one.

elements.description:
All datetime components rely on [Moment.js](https://momentjs.com/) and [Moment Timezone](https://momentjs.com/timezone/).

This element renders a calendar for a given decade, year, or month, based on `display-mode` and `base-date`.
A user can either select a range of dates or a single date, based on the `prevent-range-selection` property.
User-selected values can be read out from the `range` or `single-selected-date` properties accordingly.
A single date or range can be pre-set by manually setting either `from-moment` (single date) or `from-moment` and `to-moment` (range) using valid Moment.js objects.

### Usage

    <px-calendar-picker
      from-moment={...}
      prevent-range-selection
      single-selected-date={...}>
    </px-calendar-picker>

    <px-calendar-picker
      from-moment={...}
      to-moment={...}
      range={...}>
    </px-calendar-picker>

### Styling
The following custom properties are available for styling:

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
`--px-calendar-text-color` | Default text color for dates on the calendar
`--px-calendar-text-color--hover` | Text color for dates when hovered
`--px-calendar-text-color--selected` | Text color for dates when selected
`--px-calendar-title-color` | Color for the title and arrows
`--px-calendar-sub-labels--text-color` | Text color for days of the week
`--px-calendar-today-border` | Border color for today's date
`--px-calendar-background-color--hover` | Background color for dates when hovered
`--px-calendar-background-color--pressed` | Background color for dates when pressed
`--px-calendar-background-color--selected` | Background color for dates when selected
`--px-calendar-alt-background-color` | Background color for the range between start and end dates

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.description: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: keyBindings
properties.description:
To be used to express what combination of keys  will trigger the relative
callback. e.g. `keyBindings: { 'esc': '_onEscPressed'}`

properties.name: blockFutureDates
properties.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow future dates to be selected (future dates will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: blockPastDates
properties.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow past dates to be selected (past dates will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: __localizationCache
properties.description:
Internal singleton cache. This is the private implementation of the
behaviour; don't interact with it directly.

properties.name: language
properties.description: set a default for localizing

properties.name: resources
formats
useKeyIfMissing
properties.description:
Use the key for localization if value for  language is missing. Should
always be true for  our components

properties.name: localize
properties.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

properties.name: bubbleEvent
properties.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

properties.name: timeZone
properties.description:
Moment-timezone string for using a specific timezone. See
http://momentjs.com/timezone/docs/#/data-loading/getting-zone-names/.

If not provided, tries to guess the current local timezone.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: The minimum / earliest allowed date, as a a Moment object or an ISO 8601 String (dates before this will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description: The maximum / latest allowed date, as a a Moment object or an ISO 8601 String (dates after this will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: fromMoment
properties.description: Moment object start date & time

properties.name: toMoment
properties.description: Moment object end date & time

properties.name: presetRanges
baseDate
properties.description: Moment object used as the base for the calendar (to decide which month to display)

properties.name: displayMode
properties.description:
What the calendar should display:
 - 'day': calendar displays all days of a month
 - 'month': calendar displays all months in a year
 - 'year': calendar displays a 10 years range

properties.name: _currentDisplayMode
properties.description:
What the calendar should display:
 - 'day': calendar displays all days of a month
 - 'month': calendar displays all months in a year
 - 'year': calendar displays a 10 year range

 Can internally change when the user clicks the title and changes the mode

properties.name: preventRangeSelection
properties.description:
(optional)

By default, the calendar will allow the user to select a date range by clicking on two
different dates. If this property is set, the user will only be able to select a single date
each time she clicks.

If this property is set, then the 'singleSelectedDate' property will reflect the selected date. Otherwise
the 'range' property should be observed and will reflect the selected date range.

properties.name: hidePreviousButton
properties.description:
(optional)

Hides the 'previous' button on the calendar.

properties.name: hideNextButton
properties.description:
(optional)

Hides the 'next' button on the calendar.

properties.name: shrink
properties.description:
(optional)

If set, allows the calendar picker to shrink rather than have a constant size.
Typically the height would shrink when choosing months or years

properties.name: isAtSelectionLevel
properties.description:
Whether the calendar picker is currently at the selection level: showing days
in day mode, choosing month in month mode or showing years in year mode.

properties.name: _valuesDisplayed
properties.description: The values currently displayed in the calendar cells, days, months or years

properties.name: _title
properties.description: Title string for localization

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

methods.name: __computeLocalize
methods.description: Returns a computed `localize` method, based on the current `language`.

methods.name: _preserveTime
methods.description:
Copies the time in toPreserve to dest and returns dest.
used in `px-calendar-picker`, `px-datetime-picker`, and `px-datetime-range-panel`

methods.name: _validateRangeOrder
methods.description: Validation for the range. Makes sure the ranges are in chronological order

return.desc: true if chronological order, false otherwise

methods.name: _onNextDisplayMode
methods.description: Change the display mode after the user clicked the title
